file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-05-04 - COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the lamp of the cockpit emergency light and the cockpit emergency light assembly. B. The cockpit emergency light is installed on the headliner. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT LAMP - ALL 33-50-05-000-801-A REMOVAL COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT LAMP - IN- ALL 33-50-05-400-801-A STALLATION COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT ASSEM- ALL 33-50-05-000-802-A BLY - REMOVAL COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT ASSEM- ALL 33-50-05-400-802-A BLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-05 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the lamp of the cockpit emergency light. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 Cockpit 226 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the protective lens (3). For this, pull the protector lens (3) from the headliner. (2) Remove the lamp (2) from the reflector (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-05 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Cockpit Emergency Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONES B 225 226 A DET. A HEADLINER (REF.) 1. REFLECTOR 2. LAMP 3. PROTECTIVE LENS DET. B EM145AMM330112C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-05 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the lamp of the cockpit emergency light. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 Cockpit 226 Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lamp (2) to the reflector (1). (2) Put the protective lens (3) on the headliner. (3) Push the protective lens (3) to attach it to the reflector (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-05 Page 4 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Do an operational check on the Cockpit Emergency Lights ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-05 Page 5 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-05-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the cockpit emergency light assembly with lamp or with leds. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 Cockpit 226 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the cockpit emergency light assembly with lamp as follows (Figure 402): (a) Remove the protective lens (2). For this, pull the protector lens (2) from the headliner (4). (b) Remove the four screws (3) that attach the reflector (1) to the headliner (4). (c) Remove the two screws (6) and the four washers (5) to totally remove the cockpit emergency light to the aircraft. (2) Remove the cockpit emergency light assembly with leds as follows (Figure 403): EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 6 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Remove the protective lens (2). For this, pull the protector lens (2) from the headliner (4). (b) Remove the four screws (3) that attach the reflector (1) to the headliner (4). (c) Disconnect the electrical connector (5) to totally remove the cockpit emergency light to the aircraft. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Cockpit Emergency Light Assembly with Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONES 225 226 DET. A 5. WASHER (4) 6. SCREW (2) 4. HEADLINER 1. REFLECTOR 3. SCREW (4) 2. PROTECTIVE LENS DET. B EM145AMM330827A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 8 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Cockpit Emergency Light Assembly with Leds - Removal/Installation Figure 403 ZONES B 225 226 A DET. A 5. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 4. HEADLINER 1. REFLECTOR 3. SCREW (4) 2. PROTECTIVE LENS DET. B EM145AMM330828A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 9 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-05-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. COCKPIT EMERGENCY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the cockpit emergency light assembly with lamp or with leds. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 Cockpit 226 Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation SUBTASK 420-003-A (1) Install the cockpit emergency light assembly with lamp as follows (Figure 402): (a) Tighten the two screws (6) and four washers (5) to install the cockpit emergency light to the aircraft. (b) Tighten the four screws (3) to attach the reflector (1) to the headliner (4). (c) Put the protective lens (2) on the reflector (1). (d) Push the protective lens (2) to attach it to the reflector (1). (2) Install the cockpit emergency light assembly with leds as follows (Figure 403): EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 10 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Connect the electrical connector (5) to install the cockpit emergency light to the aircraft. (b) Tighten the four screws (3) to attach the reflector (1) to the headliner (4). (c) Put the protective lens (2) on the reflector (1). (d) Push the protective lens (2) to attach it to the reflector (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do an operational check on the Cockpit Emergency Lights ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-05 Page 11 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
